document.masterDocTitle: Variable Selection and Inference for Multi-period Forecasting Problems

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Variable Selection and Inference for Multi-period Forecasting Problems

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. The most similar species is
P. pseudomontagui
. The females of both species are unique in having the inner hind tibial spur coarsely serrate and the discs of metasomal terga T1–T3 more densely punctate than the rest of the terga (forming a transverse band of minute, dense punctures). The morphological characters to distinguish the females of both species are very subtile. The females of
P . montagui
differ from those of
P. pseudomontagui
in having the lower part of paraocular area more sparsely punctate, the scutum more densely punctate (i = d) and the vestiture of hind tibial scopae greyish (yellowish in
P. pseudomontagui
). The males of
P. montagui
differ from those of
P. pseudomontagui
in the structure and size of the metasomal sternum S8, which is broad in size and deeply emarginated apically in
P. pseudomontagui
and longish in size and angulated apically in
P. montagui
.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 18.
Patellapis
( P .) montagui
, female: a. Head (scale=1mm); b. Scutum (scale=1mm); c. Scutellum and propodeum (scale=0,5mm); d. Metasomal terga T1-T3 (scale=1mm); e. Body (scale=1mm); f. Inner hind tibial spur (scale=100µm); g. Basitibial plate (scale=100µm).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Male . Bl = 8,9–9,3mm . Head . L = 2,1–2,2mm ; W = 2,3–2,5mm . Head wider than long ( Fig. 19a ). Integument black except mandibles partly reddish-brown. Clypeus, supraclypeal area, paraocular area and vertex with loose, greyish, erect hairs; clypeus, supraclypeal area and lower half of paraocular area entirely covered with appressed, white hairs. Mandibles simple. Antennae brownish-black. Flagellomeres knotty. A4 about 2,0 times longer than A3. Mesosoma . L = 1,6–1,7mm ; W (ITS) = 1,6–1,7mm . Integument black. Scutum strongly and densely punctate (i = d) ( Fig. 19b ). Scutellum as illustrated in Fig. 19c . Scutum, metanotum, mesepisternum and propodeum with long, greyish, erect hairs. Scutellum with long, yellowish erect hairs. Basal area of propodeum as illustrated in Fig. 19c ; propodeum shiny and densely punctate. Marginal region of posterior truncation shiny and reticulate. Wings . Slightly fuscous. Legs . Integument brownish to black. Vestiture mostly greyish. Metasoma . L = 5,3–5,4mm ; W = 2,5–2,6mm . Integument brownish-black except the margins of T pallid brownish and partly translucent. Metasomal terga as illustrated in Fig. 19d . Apical plate broad and broadly rounded apically. Posterior margin of S4 with a dense row of coarse, erect bristles. S5 with fan-shaped hair patches laterally ( Fig. 19e ). S7 and S8 as illustrated in
Fig. 19f
. Genitalia . Genitalia as illustrated in
Fig. 19g –h
; gonocoxa shiny and gonostylus simple, without a dorsolateral projection.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 19.
Patellapis
( P .) montagui
, male: a. Head (scale=1mm); b. Scutum (scale=1mm); c. Scutellum and propodeum (scale=0,5mm); d. Metasomal terga (scale=1mm); e. Metasomal sterna (scale=1mm); f. Metasomal sterna S7 and S8, ventral view (scale=0,5mm); g. Genitalia, dorsal view (scale=0,5mm); h. Genitalia, lateral view (scale=0,5mm).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material (
1 specimen ). Holotype , female, Type (round red-white label), B.M. TYPE HYM 17 a 1090 (white label), Halictus montagui Ckll. Type (handwritten white label), Cape Province , Montagu , [S33°47' / E20°07'],
1–21. Oct. 1924
(white label), S. Africa. R . E. Turner , Brit. Mus. 1924–466 (white label), BMNH .
